intro: Reynoutria baldschuanica, commonly known as the Caucasian arrowhead, is a perennial herb native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as stream banks and wet meadows. Its flowering stems bear small, greenish-white flowers that appear in late summer. Reynoutria baldschuanica is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other regions for horticultural purposes.
